metadata.feature_description: Provides integration points for social modules like Answers, Blogs, and Discussions.

steps.expected: Activity Stream module should load and display posts
steps.actual: Community page loaded successfully with Activity Stream showing posts, comments, likes, mentions, and social interactions

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify menu items for social features (Activity Filter)

steps.action: Click on Filter by activity dropdown on Community page
steps.expected: Dropdown should show all social module activity types
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed all social module types: Posts, Links, Photos, Files, Forum Topics, Forum Replies, Blogs, Friends, Group Created, Group Joined, Added to Wiki, Updated Wiki, Documents, Articles, Videos, Votes, Comments, Questions, Answers, Events, Ideas, Challenges, Badges

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify social module tabs in Groups

steps.action: Navigate to Test Activity Group page
steps.expected: Group page should display tabs for all social modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki)
steps.actual: Group page loaded with all social module tabs visible: Activity, Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Members, Wiki, and a + button to add more

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify social modules installed in Extensions

steps.action: Check Extensions panel in PersonaBar for installed social modules
steps.expected: Social modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events, Wiki) should be listed and marked as In Use
steps.actual: Extensions panel showed all social modules installed and In Use: Activities (Yes), Activity Stream (Yes), Answers (Yes), Blogs (Yes), Discussions (Yes), Ideas (Yes), Social Events (Yes), Wiki (Yes)

observations: The social module integration is implemented through the EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs which defines KnownSocialModules: Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events, Wiki, Challenges
The FindFirstSocialModuleOnPage() method detects social modules present on pages and passes this information to the PersonaBar configuration
All social modules are properly integrated into Group Spaces with navigation tabs for each module type
The Activity Stream filter dropdown provides comprehensive filtering options for all social activity types
PersonaBar correctly identifies pages containing social modules and shows the Edit button for content management
